briefdescription.para: Creates a new object tree, representing a mapping from paths to handler vtables.

parameterdescription.para: the connection this tree belongs to

simplesect.para: the new tree or NULL if no memory

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusObjectTree *tree, dbus_bool_t fallback, const char **path, const DBusObjectPathVTable *vtable, void *user_data, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_object_tree_register

briefdescription.para: Registers a new subtree in the global object tree.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to handle messages to children of this path
NULL-terminated array of path elements giving path to subtree
the vtable used to traverse this subtree
user data to pass to methods in the vtable
address where an error can be returned

simplesect.para: FALSE if an error (DBUS_ERROR_NO_MEMORY or DBUS_ERROR_OBJECT_PATH_IN_USE) is reported

briefdescription.para: Unregisters an object subtree that was registered with the same path.

parameterdescription.para: path to the subtree (same as the one passed to _dbus_object_tree_register())

briefdescription.para: Tries to dispatch a message by directing it to handler for the object path listed in the message header, if any.

detaileddescription.para: Messages are dispatched first to the registered handler that matches the largest number of path elements; that is, message to /foo/bar/baz would go to the handler for /foo/bar before the one for /foo.

briefdescription.para: Looks up the data passed to _dbus_object_tree_register() for a handler at the given path.

parameterdescription.para: NULL-terminated array of path elements giving path to subtree

simplesect.para: the object's user_data or NULL if none found

briefdescription.para: Free all the handlers in the tree.

detaileddescription.para: Lock on tree's connection must not be held.

briefdescription.para: Lists the registered fallback handlers and object path handlers at the given parent_path.

detaileddescription.para: The returned array should be freed with dbus_free_string_array().

parameterdescription.para: the path to list the child handlers of

simplesect.para: FALSE if no memory to allocate the child entries

detaileddescription.para: A path of just "/" is represented as an empty vector of strings. The path need not be nul terminated.

parameterdescription.para: the length of the path string
address to store new object path

ref.tooltip: Macro used prior to declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
Macro used after declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
